title: Unexpected panic when exporting an item of renamed proc-macro dependency with select targets.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I get an internal compiler error (unexpected panic) when I export an item of an (in `Cargo.toml`) renamed proc-macro library dependency. This only happens with select targets and only on stable and nightly. It still fails to compile on beta, but with a different error (see Error output section). I've tested the following targets which all have this bug (on stable, beta (different as described) and nightly): - `thumbv6m-none-eabi` command `cargo +nightly/beta/stable build --target thumbv6m-none-eabi` - `thumbv7em-none-eabi` command `cargo +nightly/beta/stable build --target thumbv6m-none-eabi` - `thumbv7em-none-eabihf` command `cargo +nightly/beta/stable build --target thumbv7em-none-eabihf` - `thumbv7m-none-eabi` command `cargo +nightly/beta/stable build --target thumbv7m-none-eabi` It compiles fine with target `x86_64-pc-windows-msvc`. ### Code ~~https://github.com/N3xed/rustc-proc-macros-dep-rename-bug~~ ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: #### Stable ``` rustc 1.47.0 (18bf6b4f0 2020-10-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: 18bf6b4f01a6feaf7259ba7cdae58031af1b7b39 commit-date: 2020-10-07 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.47.0 LLVM version: 11.0 ```
Beta

``` rustc 1.48.0-beta.8 (121901459 2020-11-08) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1219014599fd873fcb640b675d8a662150c74e40 commit-date: 2020-11-08 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.48.0-beta.8 LLVM version: 11.0 ```

Nightly

``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (9722952f0 2020-11-12) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9722952f0bed5815cb22cb4878be09fb39f92804 commit-date: 2020-11-12 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.49.0-nightly ```

### Error output For `stable` and `nightly`: ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'src\librustc_resolve\imports.rs:907:25: inconsistent resolution for an import', /rustc/18bf6b4f01a6feaf7259ba7cdae58031af1b7b39\src\librustc_middle\util\bug.rs:34:26 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0 (18bf6b4f0 2020-10-07) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `rustc-dep-rename-bug`. Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name rustc_dep_rename_bug --edition=2018 'src\lib.rs' --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type lib --emit=dep-info,metadata,link -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=184209647542cd98 -C extra-filename=-184209647542cd98 --out-dir 'F:\proj\rustc-dep-rename-bug\target\thumbv7em-none-eabihf\debug\deps' --target thumbv7em-none-eabihf -C 'incremental=F:\proj\rustc-dep-rename-bug\target\thumbv7em-none-eabihf\debug\incremental' -L 'dependency=F:\proj\rustc-dep-rename-bug\target\thumbv7em-none-eabihf\debug\deps' -L 'dependency=F:\proj\rustc-dep-rename-bug\target\debug\deps' --extern 'inner=F:\proj\rustc-dep-rename-bug\target\debug\deps\inner_crate-b0ffcafb96ec16ac.dll'` (exit code: 101) ``` For `beta`: ``` error: inconsistent resolution for an import --> src\lib.rs:4:9 | 4 | pub use inner::*; | ^^^^^^^^ error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `rustc-dep-rename-bug` ```
Backtrace

Note: This is the backtrace with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` because the backtrace with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` was empty. ``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff906509f69 - ::fmt::h4619ab1e0e7f537e 1: 0x7ff906536f7b - core::fmt::write::h84ceeb961f15abff 2: 0x7ff9064fbae4 - ::fmt::h9d23b0cc8f33253b 3: 0x7ff90650f5cb - std::panicking::take_hook::h7242e84e70bd80e5 4: 0x7ff90650f209 - std::panicking::take_hook::h7242e84e70bd80e5 5: 0x7ff8ff2ebd4a - rustc_driver::report_ice::h7d9caf57ab1969dd 6: 0x7ff90650ff60 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hf4a559ff56f2af2e 7: 0x7ff901cea348 - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 8: 0x7ff901cea09f - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 9: 0x7ff901d04636 - ::fmt::hdcb44dd35d63475d 10: 0x7ff901ce0a93 - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 11: 0x7ff901ce0941 - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 12: 0x7ff901ce08a3 - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 13: 0x7ff901ce09ec - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 14: 0x7ff901ce09a5 - ::visit_ty::h7f22dfa4b757f3a7 15: 0x7ff901dcf1c2 - rustc_resolve::imports::ImportResolver::finalize_imports::h78444ceb2da1444a 16: 0x7ff901dcc478 - rustc_resolve::imports::ImportResolver::finalize_imports::h78444ceb2da1444a 17: 0x7ff901d70f2d - rustc_resolve::Resolver::resolve_crate::hd2ff456bde7ce3ae 18: 0x7ff8ff5de608 - rustc_interface::passes::BoxedResolver::to_resolver_outputs::hc2b95e96c6a88100 19: 0x7ff8ff5b9677 - rustc_interface::interface::parse_cfgspecs::hf6674ffb8d3b457b 20: 0x7ff8ff5a3f16 - ::visit_mac::h7f03029727239706 21: 0x7ff8ff5dcc77 - rustc_interface::interface::parse_cfgspecs::hf6674ffb8d3b457b 22: 0x7ff8ff602d28 - rustc_interface::queries::Queries::expansion::h22ef0bc36e8f7ef3 23: 0x7ff8ff30ae7b - ::deref::h7f567a06a647f4b8 24: 0x7ff8ff2a2b8c - ::fmt::h28b34d043f942f5d 25: 0x7ff8ff30c88b - ::deref::h7f567a06a647f4b8 26: 0x7ff8ff2f9c90 - ::deref::h7f567a06a647f4b8 27: 0x7ff8ff30046f - ::deref::h7f567a06a647f4b8 28: 0x7ff8ff29b5c3 - ::fmt::h6e3d1b05eaab99a2 29: 0x7ff90651fcca - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::hffe67e116ae8824f 30: 0x7ff95c707034 - BaseThreadInitThunk 31: 0x7ff95c83cec1 - RtlUserThreadStart ```
